oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spaying of Western Range Heifers
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Curtis, Jim
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: chute
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Spayed heifers can be run with steers, breeding heifers or even stock cows without causing the least disturbance to the herd because of cycling. Bulls need not be provided for them and the cost of spaying is much less than the cost of breeding
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1981; 138-139
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 1981 American Association of Bovine Practitioners
